DOC.detailed_description: This study three-armed , randomize , patient , physician , assessor-blinded , control pilot aim evaluate comparative clinical effectiveness pharmacopuncture severe non-acute sciatic pain patient diagnose lumbar disc herniation ( LDH ) usual care conventional medicine Korean medicine ( acupuncture ) . Sixty patient severe non-acute sciatic pain patient diagnose LDH ( NRS ≥5 , onset 4 week 6 month ) recruit , randomize 20 Shinbaro pharmacopuncture ( pharmacopuncture+acupuncture ) , acupuncture , usual care group , respectively . The 2 acupuncture group receive 2 sessions/week acupuncture alone pharmacopuncture 4 week ( total 8 session ) , usual care group receive conventional medication 2 times/day 2 sessions/week physical therapy ( total 8 session ) . The initial acupuncture physician administer acupuncture 5 acupoints ( GB30 , BL40 , BL25 , BL23 , GB34 ) 2 acupuncture group , mark additional acupoint . A second acupuncture physician administer pharmacopuncture mark acupoint pharmacopuncture group , acupuncture acupuncture group . Post-treatment evaluation take place 5 , 7 , 9 , 12 week randomization .
